channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024070180
item.description:
Report E-2024070180

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent absorbents and containerized it along with the damaged pail in one 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070654
item.description:
Report X-2024070654

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKER WAS IDENTIFIED ON DOOR 4 IN THE UNLOAD, RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH A SPILL TUB, PADS, AND PPE. THE BOX WAS LEAKING, AND PARTIALLY OPEN. IT DIDN'T LOOK LIKE A TYPICAL HOUSEHOLD ITEM SO RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX A BIT MORE AND SAW THE CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL. THEN PROCEEDED TO NOTIFY MY SUPERVISOR AND CONTINUE CLEANUP. RESPONDER CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK AND NOTIFIED THEM, PROCESSED IN ETT, TOOK PICTURES OF ALL 6 SIDES OF THE BOX, AND HOLD FOR INSPECITON.

item.title: Report X-2024070369
item.description:
Report X-2024070369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: OAK PARK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipper shipped a box containing three laptops and six tablets, all of which still had their Li-Ion batteries installed, without placing either a Class 9 diamond label or UN3481 Li-Ion battery sticker on the outside of the box. One of the cells in the Li-Ion battery of one of the laptops started generating a current, despite the laptop being powered off. This resulted in a buildup of heat sufficient to melt the malfunctioning battery cell, part of the laptop case, and some of the bubble wrap surrounding the laptop. It also gave off smoke and an unpleasant odor.

item.title: Report X-2024070115
item.description:
Report X-2024070115

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SITUATION. THERE WAS NO SPILLAGE. NO 5 PART FORMS.NO UN INFORMATION. NO DIAMOND LABELS WERE INCLUDED IN THIS SHIPMENT. THE CONTENTS WAS NITROUS OXIDE CYLINDERS. THE INNER CARTONS WERE STORE SHELF BOXES MARKED WITH A NON FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL AND SECONDARY LABEL WAS AN OXIDIZER 5.1 DIAMOND LABEL. NO HAZARDOUS MARKING ON THE OUTER CARTON. (25 PACKAGES) WITH NO INDICATION ON THE OUTER BOX IT CONTAINS ANY HAZARDOUS MATERIAL.

item.title: Report E-2024070038
item.description:
Report E-2024070038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was exiting highway to stop at the facility and heard a whoosh sound thought he had blown a tire he stopped and checked and tires were good. He then proceeded to facility and when doing a post trip he noticed the top of the trailer had residue on it that had come from the pressure relief valve. He then called the emergency number at 0800ET. Crews were dispatched and arrive at approximately 1300ET to clean the residue off the tanker. The crew dawned the proper PPE and proceeded to clean the residue and dispose of the cleaning rags in the appropriate manor. The crew was complete at 1700ET.

item.title: Report E-2024070054
item.description:
Report E-2024070054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: GARDEN CITY
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-gallon of UN1866 Class 3 PGII " SUPER DIAMOND CLEAR" was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to being punctured by a forklift impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and dispatched Clean Harbors to assist with cleanup. Clean Harbors advised one pail was damaged and the spilled material was impacting 4 other pails. Clean Harbors cleaned the released material and containerized the waste into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum and one (1) 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.
